t: Matthew 10
The Twelve Disciples; Instructions for Service
Jesus*p summoned His twelve disciples and gave them authority over unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal every kind of disease and every kind of sickness.
Now*p the names of the twelve apostles are these: The first, Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew his brother; and James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother;
Philip and Bartholomew; Thomas and Matthew the tax collector; James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus;
Simon the Zealot, and Judas Iscariot, the one who betrayed Him.
These*p twelve Jesus sent out after instructing them: “Do*r not*r go*r in*r the*ir way*r of*r the*ir Gentiles,*r and*r do*r not*r enter*r any*ir city*r of*r the*r Samaritans;*r

Whoever*r does*r not*r receive*r you,*r nor*r heed*r your*r words,*r as*r you*r go*r out*r of*r that*r house*r or*r that*r city,*r shake*r the*r dust*r off*r your*r feet.*r
